title: 114_hr4704
content: The Act may be cited as the "Advancing CCUS Technology Act" and focuses on carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration technologies. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to improve the conversion, use, and storage of carbon dioxide from fossil fuels. The Coal and related technologies program is also amended to allow for large scale demonstration of technologies for carbon capture. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to enhance carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration projects. The Secretary of Energy must annually evaluate and make recommendations for these projects. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to enhance carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration projects. The Secretary of Energy must evaluate projects to advance specific goals of carbon capture technologies. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to evaluate projects advancing carbon capture technologies and determine progress for potential increased funding. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to evaluate carbon capture projects, assess funding needs, determine project potential, and issue reports every 2 years on evaluations and recommendations. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 requires the Secretary of Energy to submit reports every 2 years to Congress on evaluations and recommendations for carbon capture projects. These reports are also made available on the Department of Energy's website. The Department of Energy is making progress in advancing carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration technologies to achieve its goal of having advanced technologies ready for large-scale demonstration by 2020.
